comment:
Pros:
His tests are not too difficult.
He gives up to 10% extra credit on each exam

Cons:
He is not actually a good teacher.
He goes through the lectures very quickly.
He does not pause for students to gather their thoughts before moving to the next topic.
He takes a long time to grade.
His handwriting is not legible.
He is very disorganized.

He is kind and is willing to work with students, but is a little too smart for his own good and it makes it a little hard to learn from him since he kind of explains it like its a duh. In terms of stats teachers I've had ones who really explain things and how to do it and approach it on a student level, and then ones like him who don't

He teaches really fast and doesn't really show the step to the answer. This class it self was hard for me, I have never taken intro to stat before so I was in a disadvantage.  Going over the PowerPoints every day you should be fine by test week. The HW are easy and not really graded for accuracy. Its a helps cushion your grade. Good professor tho.

Very chill professor, don't be afraid to go to office hours and ask questions. It was difficult to reach over email, but it gave excellent lectures and never made you feel bad for asking questions. I highly recommend this professor for this course. Study the PPTs, HW, and study guides and you'll do fine.

Very sweet and teaches well. Funny sarcastic guy. All exams in person, but we did our final online. That may not be the case for you. The final was hard but he did add extra credit to it. Allows extra credit for all tests if you want extra points. I failed the final but still got an A in the class due to the extra credit.

Graded on weekly homework that is graded for completion and is 25% of your final grade, and 3 tests. He gives an extra credit assignment after each test so you can recover some missed points. Attendance is used to give extra credit on the last test at the end of the semester. He was also very kind to students who had questions.

I mean for the entire semester, I was fine in that class. Maintained good grades, and then at the end of the semester, he drops my grade a full 70 points on my final exam for missing only like 5 days of class. Horrible way to end of the semester. Good teacher, just if you miss a day of class, it will impact your final exam.
Make sure you study the material after class, there are weekly h.w assignments and 4 tests. The tests are not open notes.

Professor Wearne is...meh. He takes ages and ages to grade things and is very boring to listen to. He also likes to play "attendance games" that is just classwork that doesn't count for a grade or anything. The tests are in person and closed book/notes, so be prepared to really have to study the material a lot. Attendance is mandatory.

Attendance is not mandatory but you need to go to class to get this stuff. He explains everything well and organized all of the grades so you could follow along. He was always willing to answer questions and help you out if you needed it. If you participate youll succeed. He added my attendance to my final grade and it bumped me up like 6 points.

Will give you a 0 for not showing work even if the math is basic and can be done in your literal head. Chill nice professor but seems like he really doesn't care whether you pass or not. Does give extra credit for showing up to class so that's a plus!

I highly recommend Wearne. He was extremely helpful, broke down each unit piece by piece and is willing to help in and out of class. He isn't a harsh grader or professor. He is a great professor but he is gentle at heart as well. A professor with good charecter helps alot when the semester can get difficult. I have no complaints!

A very good professor as long as you attend class. Very willing to help and gives good feedback. All tests except for the final exam are in person and there are weekly homework assignments due online. Definitely recommend.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy

comment: Attendance isn't mandatory but suggested. Graded by three tests and homework (which is a participation grade.) His in-person class tests are not open book or open note so be prepared to study the material. He offers bonus points for exams by retaking it for half-credit to supplement the points you didn't earn on the exam. Great teacher overall.

Wearne is a great choice for BStat! He is so kind and honestly really cares about his students. He has weekly zoom study sessions, gives lengthy lectures but they really help when it comes to the exams. No homework, but it does help to have great notes and online resources when it comes to test time. ;)

Genuinely cares about every student understanding the material & doing well. Had recorded powerpoint lectures with recorded drawings & everything. It was like sitting in a live lecture. Explained everything really well & held a session most weeks to go over the chapter problems & answer any questions. Even had an optional test to earn points back.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Clear grading criteria--Amazing lectures

comment: Wearne is great! There were like 10ish problem sets each week worth 25% of our grade that were just graded on completion. We could work with our classmates on them. 3 tests all open book. Offered 10 points extra credit on one of the tests. Super easy class!
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Test heavy--Clear grading criteria

comment: Good guy, cares about the class. The 3 tests aren't terrible and weekly homework is participation based. Sets you up for success.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Clear grading criteria--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Dr. Wearne uploads zoom review sessions, detailed presentations & notes over everything you will need on the few exams that determine your grade in the class and admission to Coles. This professor is easily one of the best I have taken, and his grading is very straight forward and he is remarkably helpful compared to some others. Take him!

He holds zoom sessions once a week to answer questions about his prerecorded lectures/homework, and he is helpful if you're struggling. His lectures cover everything, so you don't really need to buy the book. Toward the end of the semester, he offers a makeup "mastery test" to earn up to 10 pts on your lowest test grade. Easy A if you do the work.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Clear grading criteria--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Prof Wearne makes business stat simple and to the point. Only grades are 3 tests and completion grade homework once a week. He is super accessible and hosts zoom calls once a week to go over anything. He also posted these zoom calls on d2l. He also held review sessions before tests and offered test remediation. He is great! Take him if you can!

Take him! His lectures are to the point and very easy to follow along. Online due to covid- no lockdown or webcam for tests. Only grades based on tests and homework- just turn it in and you get credit. Super great guy all around. Very clear in his emails about how the semester and assignments will go. You will not regret taking him!!
He actually cares, which is surprising.
straight forward and gets to the point, study and you will pass, simple as that.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Clear grading criteria--Amazing lectures

comment: Dude is amazing, 10/10 would recommend.
